topics.body:
"@Number1pegasus":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b45bf36368727a27b30300#post_54b45bf36368727a27b30300
[bq="Number1pegasus"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54b45b436368727cc90e0300#post_54b45b436368727cc90e0300
Wait what? Why?!

The fights look awesome and the main character is a nerdy school girl with glasses which is awesome!

Reminds me of "Read or die"[/bq]
One word: weaboos.

Any time anything tries to go outside the comfort zone it financially dies.

Think of it like what happened to Bioshock Infinite; even though Bioshock Infinite was really good because it wasn't Call Of Duty it financially failed and as a result the Bioshock franchise is dead.  I know I sound like a broken record about what I call "the naruto effect" but it's the same deal; right now there's a ton of video games that financially die because they're not call of duty; Yozakura Quartet failed because it was not Naruto.

I'll admit Yozakura Quartet isn't a masterpiece, but it's far from a bad show which sucks that it was one of the franchises that financially got fucked over cause of Naruto's popularity causing a detrimental effect on the anime industry.  A lot of people aren't fans of the genre or such that's totally understandable and if someone reading this that checks out the show doesn't like it, but it really sucks that the show failed popularity wise because it wasn't a naruto clone.



If like non-black and white story telling set in a supernatural setting then I would suggest checking it out.  On the other hand if you're a naruto fan I would not suggest watching it cause across the board naruto fans, with no exaggeration at all, seem to outright hate the series.
